data.headline: S&P 500 slipped 0.27% while Nasdaq fell 0.66%, marking a five-week losing streak for the tech-heavy index
bullets: Tech and chip stocks, including Nvidia, Apple, Microsoft, and Meta, came under pressure amid AI disruption concerns and competition from Alibaba’s Qwen 3.5
Danaher dropped about 5% after a mixed post-earnings miss, while General Mills fell 3–4% on a trimmed 2026 forecast
ZIM surged on buyout speculation and Norwegian Cruise Line jumped 6–9% following Elliott activist interest
Genuine Parts rallied on a dividend hike and spin-off announcement; Fiserv also gained
Media and private-equity M&A hopes rose on renewed Warner Bros. Discovery–Paramount tie-up chatter and Blackstone’s pursuit of Champions Group
Traders are monitoring thin flows, tariff-driven price warnings, and upcoming Fed minutes, jobs data, Q4 GDP, Friday’s PCE inflation, and key earnings for direction
No major economic releases today, but a noted productivity surge is masking a slowdown in white-collar hiring
